title: Personal Portfolio - Single Page Application
shortDescription: Modern, responsive portfolio website built with Angular 20, showcasing full-stack development skills and design capabilities
description: Designed and developed a comprehensive Single Page Application portfolio website from scratch using Angular 20. The project demonstrates advanced frontend development skills, modern UI/UX design principles, and optimization techniques. Built with a mobile-first approach, the portfolio features smooth animations, dynamic content loading, and an intuitive navigation system. Implemented cutting-edge Angular features including Signals for reactive state management and standalone components for better modularity.
problemStatement: As a developer seeking opportunities, I needed a professional platform to showcase my work that would stand out from generic portfolio templates. Generic solutions lacked the flexibility to highlight my unique skills and didn't perform well on mobile devices. Many existing portfolios were either overly complex or too simplistic, failing to demonstrate both technical capability and design sensibility.
objectif: Create a professional online presence to showcase development skills and projects
Implement modern Angular 20 features (Signals, standalone components) for optimal performance
Design an intuitive, accessible, and visually appealing user interface
Achieve excellent performance scores (90+ on Lighthouse) and SEO optimization
Ensure full responsiveness across all devices and screen sizes
Demonstrate proficiency in frontend architecture and best practices

developmentProcess.description: Analyzed competitor portfolios, defined user personas (recruiters, fellow developers, clients), created wireframes in Figma, and established project requirements
Established color palette with dark/light theme support, typography scale, spacing system, and reusable component library following atomic design principles
Built Angular standalone components incrementally, implemented routing structure, integrated animations with Intersection Observer, and created responsive layouts
Created JSON-driven content architecture, optimized images (WebP conversion), implemented lazy loading, and fine-tuned CSS animations for 60fps performance
Conducted accessibility testing with NVDA and VoiceOver, performance optimization to achieve 95+ Lighthouse score, cross-browser testing, and GitHub Pages deployment with custom domain

technicalDecisions.question: Why Angular 20 over React/Vue?
technicalDecisions.answer: Chose Angular for its TypeScript-first approach, built-in dependency injection system, comprehensive CLI tooling, and strong opinionated structure that scales well for larger applications. The framework's maturity and enterprise-grade features made it ideal for demonstrating professional development practices.

technicalDecisions.question: Why Standalone Components?
technicalDecisions.answer: Adopted standalone components to reduce boilerplate code, improve tree-shaking (achieved 15% smaller bundle size), simplify lazy loading configuration, and demonstrate knowledge of Angular's latest architectural patterns. This modern approach eliminates the need for NgModules in most cases.

technicalDecisions.question: Why SCSS over CSS-in-JS?
technicalDecisions.answer: Selected SCSS for zero runtime overhead (styles compiled at build time), familiar syntax for team collaboration, powerful features like mixins and functions for maintainable code, and better performance compared to CSS-in-JS solutions that add JavaScript parsing costs.

technicalDecisions.question: Why JSON data store instead of backend API?
technicalDecisions.answer: Implemented local JSON data source for faster development iteration, zero hosting costs, simplified deployment (no backend infrastructure), and instant page loads. This approach also demonstrates clean separation of concerns and makes future backend integration straightforward.

features.title: Performance Optimized
features.description: Lazy loading, code splitting, and optimized assets achieving 95+ Lighthouse score with sub-second load times. Route-based code splitting reduces initial bundle to 30KB.

features.title: Modern UI/UX Design
features.description: Custom-designed interface with smooth animations, glassmorphism effects, and intuitive navigation patterns. Micro-interactions provide feedback at 60fps using CSS transforms.

features.title: Fully Responsive
features.description: Mobile-first approach with optimized layouts for smartphones (320px+), tablets, and desktop screens up to 4K. Breakpoints tested on 15+ device sizes.

features.title: Modular Architecture
features.description: Component-based structure using Angular standalone components for maintainability and scalability. Clear separation of concerns with services, models, and presentation layers.

features.title: Dynamic Content
features.description: JSON-driven project showcase with dynamic routing and smooth page transitions. Content updates require only JSON edits, no code changes.

features.title: Accessibility First
features.description: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant with semantic HTML5, proper ARIA labels, keyboard navigation support, and screen reader compatibility tested with NVDA and VoiceOver.

challenges.problem: Creating smooth scroll animations and transitions while maintaining 60fps performance across all devices, including lower-end mobile phones
challenges.solution: Implemented CSS transforms and will-change properties for GPU acceleration. Used Intersection Observer API for efficient scroll-triggered animations instead of scroll event listeners. Achieved consistent 60fps performance even on lower-end devices by optimizing animation timing functions, reducing paint operations, and limiting simultaneous animations to 3 elements max.
